Node.definition: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to laugh (at someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities express their lack of respect for (other) humans, often accompanied by laughter
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

= relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a pig (חֲזִיר) associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= state in which humans are healthy and strong
= state in which humans are in lack of something that they are supposed to have; ≈ associated with hardship
= condition of not having food to eat
= state in which humans are unable to conceive a child
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
= time of day when it becomes dark
= state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed
= state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed
= causative action by which humans remove leaves, branches, fruits, or the entire stalk of a plant

= meaning unsure; possibly: a plant which grows up to 2 m tall; its stem and branches have small silver gray leaves covered with tiny hairs; it is found in abundance in salty areas in the desert and on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea and the Dead Sea; ◄ Atriplex halimus (shrubby orache); ► the leaves are edible, though salty
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

= a tough desert shrub, up to 2 m tall, with many small branches, few leaves, and clusters of white flowers; ◄ Retama raetam; ► provides some shade in the desert, and its roots contain oil and so make a very hot fire
= a group of people living together in a more or less ordered community
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= empty, open place ◄ in a solid body
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= piece of stone of relatively large size; ◄ found in nature ► used as hiding place
= the area separating two or mores locations
meaning unsure; possibly: = plant with thorns or another desert shrub, like nettle (|iUrtica dioica|i* or |iUrtica pilulifera|i*); ► useless; ≈ symbol of uncultivated areas
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state of being associated with a certain attribute, attitude, or behavior, ◄ referred to as a child of that attribute, attitude, or behavior
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= causative action by which humans force other humans to leave a certain place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= a song (שִׁיר) ► written and sung to make fun of someone
literally: not to withhold spit; = action by which humans are unwilling to restrain themselves from spitting at somebody; ≈ associated with contempt

Node.gloss: to loosen (someone's bowstring) > to render (someone) weak, vulnerable
Node.definition: literally: to loosen (someone's) bowstring; hence: = causative action by which deities reduce the strength of humans and make them more vulnerable
literally: to untie (someone's) bowstring; hence: = causative action by which deities remove humans from a position of power and status, ◄ as if by removing the string from their bow to disarm them
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= action by which humans exercise self control of oneself
= causative action by which humans remove an object that is attached to part of their body
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

Node.gloss: to thrust aside (someone's) feet > to send (someone) sprawling
Node.definition: literally: to send away one's feet; hence, possible: = causative action by which humans thrust aside the feet of someone who is standing up ► in order to make that person fall down; ≈ seen as an act of aggression
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
literally: to break down (someone's) path; hence: = causative action by which human make someone else's life impossible as if it were a road that had been made impassable
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation
= to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective
= action by which a group of people moves forward with an unstoppable force, ◄ like a stone that comes rolling down a slope, ► with aggressive intent
= process by which difficult circumstances start to affect humans
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= state in which humans are respected and their position in the community is secure
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

Node.gloss: to pour out (one's) heart|to pour out (one's) soul
Node.definition: literally: to pour out (one's) inner person (before someone else); hence: = to communicate one's thoughts and emotions to someone else

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
exact meaning unsure; literally: to dig out: = causative action by which a condition inflicts an excruciating pain on someone's body (literally: bones)

Node.gloss: to rest > to stop|to give up|to have respite
Node.definition: literally: to rest; hence: = state in which an event stops taking place, as if in need of rest
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: to disguise oneself; hence: = process by which an object gradually becomes unrecognizable ◄ by taking on a different shape
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= opening around the neck of a garment
= general term for clothing, ◄ made of fiber cloth or animal skin, ► for covering the body
meaning unsure; possible: = to be tightly tied around part of one's body in such a way that it becomes a hindrance; ≈ used metaphorically to denote how suffering can be a hindrance to someone
= causative action by which humans or deities throw an object in a certain direction, often with force

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals
= state in which humans or deities have physical, political, or military strength
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= action by which humans or deities act with violent aggression towards (other) humans ◄ as if bearing a grudge against them

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= causative action by which humans or deities make (other) humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה) or on a cart (עֲגָלָה)
literally: to cause to melt; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to be strongly affected by fear
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: to cause (someone) to return to death; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die
= process by which humans or animals stop living

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a place where people come together for a particular purpose

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value

= heap of stones ◄ remaining after the total destruction of a town; ≈ associated with hardship and poverty|literally: ruin; hence: = someone whose former state of well being has been reversed due to misfortune and is now utterly dependent on the help of other people, and especially of God

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
literally: hard; hence: = state in which an event is associated with hardship and suffering

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
exact meaning unsure: = process by which humans experience an emotion of grief for someone else and/or express this feeling by weeping

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
literally: (one's) inner parts are boiling; hence: = process by which humans go through a phase of strong grief and distress
= action by which someone refrains from performing an event

= action by which humans meet other humans that are travelling from one location to another ► either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ often extended to describe certain events that happen in people's lives
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

Node.gloss: to grow dark|to become dark|to mourn
Node.definition: = process by which an object becomes dark in color|exact meaning unsure: = action by which humans put on dark and/or dusty clothes; or: to wear a dark and gloomy expression on their face; ◄ caused by grief as a result of the death of a loved one, ill health, oppression, suffering, or compassion for someone else's suffering; ► in order to make it publicly known that one is mourning
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
literally: the hot one; hence: = the heavenly body from which the earth derives its light and warmth; ≈ associated with light and, by extension, with happiness

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= fellow member of the same group of people, not necessarily relatives, sharing a bond of affection, employment, or a common purpose

= animal looking like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose; yellowish brown in color with red tips to the fur on the back and a bushy tail; produces mournful sounds; ≈ used mainly in poetry and associated with death, destruction, and devastation, but also with mourning and weeping
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
see יַעְַנָה (יַעֲנָה)

exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= to be affected by a burning sensation
= state of high temperature of the human body; ◄ caused by sickness
= a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing
= action by which humans play the flute; ≈ associated with joy and well being

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
